org.gradoop.storage.hbase.utils

Class RegionSplitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradoop.storage.hbase.utils.RegionSplitter

  • public class RegionSplitter
extends Object
    Singleton helper class providing functions for pre-splitting of hbase regions.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] getEndKey()
      Returns the end key of the row key range, i.e., 13 Bytes where position 0 is initialized with the number of regions and positions 1 - 12 are initialized with '1'.
      static RegionSplitter getInstance()
      Static function to return the instance of this RegionSplitter.
      int getNumberOfRegions()
      Get the number of regions.
      byte[] getStartKey()
      Returns the start key of the row key range, i.e., 13 Bytes initialized with '0'.
      void setNumberOfRegions(int numberOfRegions)
      Set the number of regions.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static RegionSplitter getInstance()
        Static function to return the instance of this RegionSplitter.
        Returns:
        the instance of this singleton

      • getStartKey

        public byte[] getStartKey()
        Returns the start key of the row key range, i.e., 13 Bytes initialized with '0'.
        Returns:
        the start key of the row key range

      • getEndKey

        public byte[] getEndKey()
        Returns the end key of the row key range, i.e., 13 Bytes where position 0 is initialized with the number of regions and positions 1 - 12 are initialized with '1'.
        Returns:
        the start key of the row key range

      • getNumberOfRegions

        public int getNumberOfRegions()
        Get the number of regions.
        Returns:
        the number of regions

      • setNumberOfRegions

        public void setNumberOfRegions(int numberOfRegions)
        Set the number of regions. The default value is DEFAULT_REGIONS.
        Parameters:
        numberOfRegions - the number of regions to use
